AI & Computational Biology.title: Comprehensive echocardiogram evaluation with view primed vision language AI
AI & Computational Biology.summary: Nature, Published online: 11 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09850-xComprehensive echocardiogram evaluation with view primed vision language AI
AI & Computational Biology.abstract: Echocardiography is the most widely used cardiac imaging modality, capturing ultrasound video data to assess cardiac structure and function1. Artificial intelligence (AI) in echocardiography has the potential to streamline manual tasks and improve reproducibility and precision2. However, most echocardiography AI models are single-view, single-task systems that do not synthesize complementary information from multiple views captured during a full exam3,4, and thus lead to limited performance and scope of applications. To address this problem, we introduce EchoPrime, a multi-view, view-informed, video-based vision-language foundation model trained on over 12 million video-report pairs. EchoPrime uses contrastive learning to train a unified embedding model for all standard views in a comprehensive echocardiogram study with representation of both rare and common diseases and diagnoses. EchoPrime then utilizes view-classification and a view-informed anatomic attention module to weight video-specific embeddings that accurately map the relationship between echocardiographic views and anatomical structures. With retrieval-augmented interpretation, EchoPrime integrates information from all echocardiogram videos in a comprehensive study and performs holistic clinical interpretation. In datasets from five international independent healthcare systems, EchoPrime achieves state-of-the art performance on 23 diverse benchmarks of cardiac form and function, surpassing the performance of both task-specific approaches and prior foundation models. Following rigorous clinical evaluation, EchoPrime can assist physicians in the automated preliminary assessment of comprehensive echocardiography.

AI & Computational Biology.title_cn: 基于视图引导视觉语言人工智能的全面超声心动图评估
AI & Computational Biology.abstract_cn: 超声心动图是应用最广泛的心脏影像学检查方法，通过捕获超声视频数据来评估心脏结构和功能1。人工智能（AI）在超声心动图领域的应用有望简化人工操作，提高结果的重现性和精确性2。然而，大多数超声心动图AI模型是单视图、单任务系统，无法综合全面检查中捕获的多个视图的互补信息3,4，从而导致性能和应用范围受限。为解决此问题，我们引入了EchoPrime，这是一个多视图、视图感知、基于视频的视觉语言基础模型，其训练数据超过1200万个视频-报告对。EchoPrime利用对比学习为全面超声心动图研究中的所有标准视图训练一个统一的嵌入模型，该模型能够表示罕见和常见疾病及诊断。随后，EchoPrime利用视图分类和视图感知的解剖注意力模块，对视频特异性嵌入进行加权，从而精确映射超声心动图视图与解剖结构之间的关系。借助检索增强型解释，EchoPrime整合了全面研究中所有超声心动图视频的信息，并进行整体临床解读。在来自五个国际独立医疗系统的数据集中，EchoPrime在23项不同的心脏形态和功能基准测试中取得了最先进的性能，超越了任务特定方法和现有基础模型的表现。经过严格的临床评估，EchoPrime能够辅助医生对全面超声心动图进行自动化初步评估。

AI & Computational Biology.title: Multimodal learning enables chat-based exploration of single-cell data
AI & Computational Biology.summary: Nature Biotechnology, Published online: 11 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41587-025-02857-9CellWhisperer uses multimodal learning of transcriptomes and text to answer questions about single-cell RNA-sequencing data.
AI & Computational Biology.abstract: Single-cell sequencing characterizes biological samples at unprecedented scale and detail, but data interpretation remains challenging. Here, we present CellWhisperer, an artificial intelligence (AI) model and software tool for chat-based interrogation of gene expression. We establish a multimodal embedding of transcriptomes and their textual annotations, using contrastive learning on 1 million RNA sequencing profiles with AI-curated descriptions. This embedding informs a large language model that answers user-provided questions about cells and genes in natural-language chats. We benchmark CellWhisperer’s performance for zero-shot prediction of cell types and other biological annotations and demonstrate its use for biological discovery in a meta-analysis of human embryonic development. We integrate a CellWhisperer chat box with the CELLxGENE browser, allowing users to interactively explore gene expression through a combined graphical and chat interface. In summary, CellWhisperer leverages large community-scale data repositories to connect transcriptomes and text, thereby enabling interactive exploration of single-cell RNA-sequencing data with natural-language chats. CellWhisperer uses multimodal learning of transcriptomes and text to answer questions about single-cell RNA-sequencing data.

AI & Computational Biology.title_cn: 多模态学习赋能单细胞数据对话式探索
AI & Computational Biology.abstract_cn: 单细胞测序以前所未有的规模和细节表征生物样本，但数据解读仍然具有挑战性。在此，我们介绍CellWhisperer，这是一种用于基因表达对话式查询的人工智能（AI）模型和软件工具。我们利用对比学习，在包含100万个RNA测序图谱及其AI策展描述的数据集上，建立了转录组及其文本注释的多模态嵌入。该嵌入为大型语言模型提供信息，使其能够在自然语言对话中回答用户提出的关于细胞和基因的问题。我们对CellWhisperer在细胞类型和其他生物学注释的零样本预测性能进行了基准测试，并展示了其在人类胚胎发育荟萃分析中用于生物学发现的潜力。我们将CellWhisperer对话框与CELLxGENE浏览器集成，使用户能够通过图形和对话相结合的界面交互式探索基因表达。总之，CellWhisperer利用大型社区规模的数据存储库连接转录组和文本，从而通过自然语言对话实现单细胞RNA测序数据的交互式探索。CellWhisperer利用转录组和文本的多模态学习来回答有关单细胞RNA测序数据的问题。

AI & Computational Biology.title: Zero-shot segmentation using embeddings from a protein language model identifies functional regions in the human proteome
AI & Computational Biology.summary: by Ami G. Sangster, Cameron Dufault, Haoning Qu, Denise Le, Julie D. Forman-Kay, Alan M. MosesThe biological function of a protein is often determined by its distinct functional units, such as folded domains and intrinsically disordered regions. Identifying and categorizing these protein segments from sequence has been a major focus in computational biology which has enabled the automatic annotation of folded protein domains. Here we show that embeddings from the unsupervised protein language model ProtT5 can be used to identify and categorize protein segments without relying on conserved patterns in primary amino acid sequence. We present Zero-shot Protein Segmentation (ZPS), where we use embeddings from ProtT5 to predict the boundaries of protein segments without training or fine-tuning any parameters. We find that ZPS boundary predictions for the human proteome are better at reproducing reviewed annotations from UniProt than established bioinformatics tools and ProtT5 embeddings of ZPS segments can categorize over 200 of the most common UniProt annotations in the human proteome, including folded domains, sub-domains, and intrinsically disordered regions. To explore ZPS predictions, we introduce a new way to visualize protein embeddings that closely resembles diagrams of distinct functional units in protein biology. Since ZPS and segment embeddings can be used without training or fine-tuning, the approach is not biased towards known annotations and can be used to identify and categorize unannotated protein segments. We used the segment embeddings to identify unannotated mitochondrion targeting signals and SYGQ-rich prion-like domains, which are functional regions within intrinsically disordered regions. We expect that the analysis of protein segment embedding similarity can lead to valuable information about protein function, including about intrinsically disordered regions and poorly understood protein regions.

AI & Computational Biology.title_cn: 基于蛋白质语言模型嵌入的零样本分割识别人类蛋白质组中的功能区域
AI & Computational Biology.abstract_cn: 蛋白质的生物学功能通常由其独特的结构单元决定，例如折叠结构域和内在无序区。从序列中识别和分类这些蛋白质片段一直是计算生物学的一个主要焦点，这使得折叠蛋白质结构域的自动注释成为可能。在此，我们展示了无监督蛋白质语言模型ProtT5的嵌入可用于识别和分类蛋白质片段，而无需依赖一级氨基酸序列中的保守模式。我们提出了零样本蛋白质分割（ZPS）方法，该方法利用ProtT5的嵌入来预测蛋白质片段的边界，而无需进行任何参数的训练或微调。我们发现，ZPS对人类蛋白质组的边界预测在重现UniProt中经过评审的注释方面优于已有的生物信息学工具，并且ZPS片段的ProtT5嵌入可以对人类蛋白质组中200多种最常见的UniProt注释进行分类，包括折叠结构域、亚结构域和内在无序区。为了探索ZPS的预测结果，我们引入了一种新的蛋白质嵌入可视化方法，该方法与蛋白质生物学中不同功能单元的图示非常相似。由于ZPS和片段嵌入无需训练或微调即可使用，因此该方法不会偏向于已知注释，可用于识别和分类未注释的蛋白质片段。我们利用这些片段嵌入识别了未注释的线粒体靶向信号和富含SYGQ的朊病毒样结构域，它们是内在无序区内的功能区域。我们预计，对蛋白质片段嵌入相似性的分析可以为蛋白质功能提供有价值的信息，包括关于内在无序区和了解不足的蛋白质区域的信息。

AI & Computational Biology.title: Universal consensus 3D segmentation of cells from 2D segmented stacks
AI & Computational Biology.summary: Nature Methods, Published online: 11 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41592-025-02887-wu-Segment3D is a universal framework that translates and enhances 2D instance segmentations to a 3D consensus instance segmentation without training data. It performs well across diverse datasets, including cells with complex morphologies.
AI & Computational Biology.abstract: Cell segmentation is the foundation of a wide range of microscopy-based biological studies. Deep learning has revolutionized two-dimensional (2D) cell segmentation, enabling generalized solutions across cell types and imaging modalities. This has been driven by the ease of scaling up image acquisition, annotation and computation. However, three-dimensional (3D) cell segmentation, requiring dense annotation of 2D slices, still poses substantial challenges. Manual labeling of 3D cells to train broadly applicable segmentation models is prohibitive. Even in high-contrast images annotation is ambiguous and time-consuming. Here we develop a theory and toolbox, u-Segment3D, for 2D-to-3D segmentation, compatible with any 2D method generating pixel-based instance cell masks. u-Segment3D translates and enhances 2D instance segmentations to a 3D consensus instance segmentation without training data, as demonstrated on 11 real-life datasets, comprising >70,000 cells, spanning single cells, cell aggregates and tissue. Moreover, u-Segment3D is competitive with native 3D segmentation, even exceeding when cells are crowded and have complex morphologies. u-Segment3D is a universal framework that translates and enhances 2D instance segmentations to a 3D consensus instance segmentation without training data. It performs well across diverse datasets, including cells with complex morphologies.

AI & Computational Biology.title_cn: 基于二维分割堆栈的细胞通用共识三维分割
AI & Computational Biology.abstract_cn: 细胞分割是广泛的基于显微镜的生物学研究的基础。深度学习彻底改变了二维（2D）细胞分割，实现了跨细胞类型和成像模式的通用解决方案。这得益于图像采集、标注和计算的规模化便利性。然而，三维（3D）细胞分割需要对二维切片进行密集标注，这仍然带来了巨大的挑战。手动标注三维细胞以训练广泛适用的分割模型是难以承受的。即使在高对比度图像中，标注也存在模糊性且耗时。在此，我们开发了一种用于2D到3D分割的理论和工具箱u-Segment3D，它兼容任何生成基于像素的实例细胞掩膜的2D方法。u-Segment3D无需训练数据即可将2D实例分割转换为并增强为3D共识实例分割，这在包含超过70,000个细胞的11个真实数据集上得到了验证，这些数据集涵盖了单细胞、细胞聚集体和组织。此外，u-Segment3D与原生3D分割方法相比具有竞争力，甚至在细胞拥挤且形态复杂时表现更优。u-Segment3D是一个通用框架，无需训练数据即可将2D实例分割转换为并增强为3D共识实例分割，并在包括形态复杂细胞在内的各种数据集上表现良好。

AI & Computational Biology.title: Digital dementia and testing of cognitive intervention for degenerating neural networks
AI & Computational Biology.summary: npj Systems Biology and Applications, Published online: 11 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41540-025-00596-wDigital dementia and testing of cognitive intervention for degenerating neural networks
AI & Computational Biology.abstract: The development of effective interventions for neurodegenerative disorders, such as posterior cortical atrophy (a visual Alzheimer’s variant), remains to be a significant clinical challenge. We introduce a computational framework using convolutional neural networks (CNNs) as in silico models to simulate visual system degeneration and evaluate intervention strategies. By modeling controlled synaptic decay and comparing three distinct retraining approaches, random data (control), accuracy-based, and entropy-based, we assess impacts on classification performance and neural representation geometry. Our results demonstrate that accuracy-based retraining outperformed other strategies, maintaining model performance and preserving optimal manifold geometry during intermediate degeneration stages. This computational analysis supports prioritizing accuracy-targeted interventions for cognitive compensation. Our framework enables rapid evaluation of intervention efficacy while elucidating computational principles underlying neurodegeneration and recovery. This approach offers a platform for refining strategies to slow visual-cognitive decline in neurodegenerative diseases, bridging mechanistic insights with clinical translation.

AI & Computational Biology.title_cn: 数字痴呆：退化神经网络认知干预策略的评估
AI & Computational Biology.abstract_cn: 神经退行性疾病（如后皮层萎缩，一种视觉型阿尔茨海默病变体）有效干预措施的开发，仍然是一个重大的临床挑战。本研究引入了一个计算框架，该框架利用卷积神经网络（CNN）作为计算机模拟模型，以模拟视觉系统退化并评估干预策略。通过模拟受控的突触衰减，并比较三种不同的再训练方法——随机数据（对照）、基于准确性和基于熵的方法，我们评估了它们对分类性能和神经表征几何结构的影响。我们的结果表明，在中间退化阶段，基于准确性的再训练优于其他策略，能够保持模型性能并保留最佳流形几何结构。这项计算分析支持优先考虑以准确性为目标的干预措施，以实现认知补偿。我们的框架能够快速评估干预措施的有效性，同时阐明神经退行性变和恢复背后的计算原理。这种方法为完善减缓神经退行性疾病中视觉认知衰退的策略提供了一个平台，将机制洞察与临床转化相结合。

AI & Computational Biology.title: Automated C. elegans behavior analysis via deep learning-based detection and tracking
AI & Computational Biology.summary: by Xiaoke Liu, Jianming Liu, Wenjie Teng, Yuzhong Peng, Boao Li, Xiaoqing Han, Jing HuoAs a well-established and extensively utilized model organism, Caenorhabditis elegans (C. elegans) serves as a crucial platform for investigating behavioral regulation mechanisms and their biological significance. However, manually tracking the locomotor behavior of large numbers of C. elegans is both cumbersome and inefficient. To address the above challenges, we innovatively propose an automated approach for analyzing C. elegans behavior through deep learning-based detection and tracking. Building upon existing research, we developed an enhanced worm detection framework that integrates YOLOv8 with ByteTrack, enabling real-time, precise tracking of multiple worms. Based on the tracking results, we further established an automated high-throughput method for quantitative analysis of multiple movement parameters, including locomotion velocity, body bending angle, and roll frequency, thereby laying a robust foundation for high-precision, automated analysis of complex worm behaviors. including movement speed, body bending angle, and roll frequency, thereby laying a robust foundation for high-precision, automated analysis of complex worm behaviors. Comparative evaluations demonstrate that the proposed enhanced C. elegans detection framework outperforms existing methods, achieving a precision of 99.5%, recall of 98.7%, and mAP50 of 99.6%, with a processing speed of 153 frames per second (FPS). The established framework for worm detection, tracking, and automated behavioral analysis developed in this study delivers superior detection and tracking accuracy while enhancing tracking continuity and robustness. Unlike traditional labor-intensive measurement approaches, our framework supports simultaneous tracking of multiple worms while maintaining automated extraction of various behavioral parameters with high precision. Furthermore, our approach advances the standardization of C. elegans behavioral parameter analysis, which can analyze the behavioral data of multiple worms at the same time, significantly improving the experimental throughput and providing an efficient tool for drug screening, gene function research and other fields.

AI & Computational Biology.title_cn: 基于深度学习检测与追踪的秀丽隐杆线虫行为自动化分析
AI & Computational Biology.abstract_cn: 秀丽隐杆线虫（C. elegans）作为一种成熟且广泛使用的模式生物，是研究行为调控机制及其生物学意义的重要平台。然而，人工追踪大量秀丽隐杆线虫的运动行为既繁琐又低效。为应对上述挑战，我们创新性地提出了一种基于深度学习检测与追踪的秀丽隐杆线虫行为自动化分析方法。在现有研究的基础上，我们开发了一个增强型线虫检测框架，该框架将YOLOv8与ByteTrack相结合，实现了多条线虫的实时精确追踪。基于追踪结果，我们进一步建立了一种自动化高通量方法，用于定量分析多种运动参数，包括运动速度、身体弯曲角度和翻滚频率，从而为复杂线虫行为的高精度自动化分析奠定了坚实基础。比较评估表明，所提出的增强型秀丽隐杆线虫检测框架优于现有方法，实现了99.5%的精确度、98.7%的召回率和99.6%的mAP50，处理速度达到每秒153帧（FPS）。本研究开发的线虫检测、追踪和自动化行为分析框架，在提供卓越的检测和追踪精度的同时，增强了追踪的连续性和鲁棒性。与传统劳动密集型测量方法不同，我们的框架支持同时追踪多条线虫，并能高精度地自动化提取各种行为参数。此外，我们的方法推动了秀丽隐杆线虫行为参数分析的标准化，能够同时分析多条线虫的行为数据，显著提高了实验通量，为药物筛选、基因功能研究等领域提供了高效工具。

AI & Computational Biology.title: A Bayesian neural ordinary differential equations framework to study the effects of chemical mixtures on survival
AI & Computational Biology.summary: by Virgile Baudrot, Nina Cedergreen, Thomas Kleiber, André Gergs, Sandrine CharlesIn the field of Plant Protection Products (PPP), the combination of multiple active ingredients is a common strategy to improve the efficacy against target species. However, these mixtures may expose non-target species to untested chemical combinations due to varied application and degradation pathways. Developing a method to predict the effects of such mixtures without extensive testing is crucial for enhancing risk assessment for non-target organisms. Toxicokinetic (TK) and toxicodynamic (TD) models currently provide predictive power for the toxicity of mixture over time, utilizing the concentration addition and independent action principles. However, their capacity to capture complex, non-linear interactions - such as synergistic and antagonistic effects - remains limited. To overcome these limitations, we introduce a new methodology that integrates TKTD models using Ordinary Differential Equations (ODE) with neural networks (NN), offering a robust framework for modeling complex substance interactions. The ODE component encodes fundamental biological principles that constrain the neural network to biologically plausible solutions. Bayesian inference further refines the model by addressing uncertainties in data, model parameters, and biological processes, while also allowing quantification of prediction uncertainty, highlighting gaps in experimental data that warrant further investigation. This hybrid model was evaluated across 99 acute toxicity studies that included various PPP mixtures, testing its ability to identify and forecast deviations from expected mixture behaviors. Our findings demonstrate that while simpler linear models provide a robust and parsimonious baseline for predicting additive mixture effects, the neural network component serves as a powerful tool for selectively identifying and forecasting significant non-linear deviations from these expectations. This dual approach clarifies the distinct roles of both simple and complex models, providing a more responsible framework to anticipate the combined effects of untested chemical mixtures and inform risk assessment practices.

AI & Computational Biology.abstract_cn: 在植物保护产品（PPP）领域，结合多种活性成分是提高对目标物种功效的常见策略。然而，由于不同的施用和降解途径，这些混合物可能使非目标物种暴露于未经测试的化学组合。开发一种无需大量测试即可预测此类混合物影响的方法，对于加强非目标生物的风险评估至关重要。目前，毒代动力学（TK）和毒效动力学（TD）模型利用浓度相加和独立作用原理，为混合物随时间变化的毒性提供了预测能力。然而，它们捕捉复杂非线性相互作用（如协同和拮抗效应）的能力仍然有限。为克服这些局限性，我们引入了一种新方法，将基于常微分方程（ODE）的TKTD模型与神经网络（NN）相结合，为复杂物质相互作用的建模提供了一个强大的框架。ODE组件编码了基本的生物学原理，将神经网络约束在生物学上合理的解决方案范围内。贝叶斯推断通过解决数据、模型参数和生物过程中的不确定性，进一步完善了模型，同时还允许量化预测不确定性，突出了需要进一步研究的实验数据空白。该混合模型在99项急性毒性研究中进行了评估，这些研究包含了各种PPP混合物，旨在测试其识别和预测与预期混合物行为偏差的能力。我们的研究结果表明，虽然更简单的线性模型为预测加性混合效应提供了稳健且简约的基线，但神经网络组件作为一种强大的工具，能够选择性地识别和预测与这些预期显著偏离的非线性效应。这种双重方法阐明了简单模型和复杂模型的不同作用，为预测未经测试的化学混合物的综合效应并为风险评估实践提供信息，提供了一个更负责任的框架。

AI & Computational Biology.title: PathoRM: Computational inference of pathogenic RNA methylation sites by incorporating multi-view features
AI & Computational Biology.summary: by Hui Liu, Jiani Ma, Xianjun Ma, Lin ZhangIdentifying pathogenic RNA methylation sites with a reasonable biological explanation has important implications for the treatment of diseases. Due to the limitations of in vitro experiments in identifying pathogenic RNA methylation sites, there is a growing need for computational workflows to enable accurate inference. Here, motivated by this profound meaning, we developed PathoRM, a biologically informed deep learning model, to infer associations between RNA methylation sites and diseases. PathoRM could provide convincing pathogenic RNA methylation sites and unravel the enigma of pathology in the epi-transcriptomic layer. PathoRM fuses RNA methylation host sequences and pathogenic descriptions as inputs, and subsequently employs large language models, multi-view learning algorithm, graph neural networks, an adversarial training approach, and “guilty-by-association”-derived negative sampling approach. PathoRM distils the semantically enriched feature embeddings, leading to more accurate and robust prediction performance across the metrics and datasets. Notably, incorporated with attention mechanism, PathoRM bestows itself biological interpretability through illuminating the dark matters in the host sequences of RNA methylation sites. This work is expected to assist in the discovery of pathogenic RNA methylation sites and conserved motifs, contributing to the advancement of genome research. Codes and pre-trained model are accessible at https://github.com/jianiM/PathoRM.

AI & Computational Biology.title_cn: PathoRM：整合多视图特征的致病性RNA甲基化位点计算推断
AI & Computational Biology.abstract_cn: 识别具有合理解释的致病性RNA甲基化位点对疾病治疗具有重要意义。鉴于体外实验在识别致病性RNA甲基化位点方面的局限性，对能够实现准确推断的计算流程的需求日益增长。受此深远意义的启发，我们开发了PathoRM，一个生物学知情的深度学习模型，用于推断RNA甲基化位点与疾病之间的关联。PathoRM能够提供有说服力的致病性RNA甲基化位点，并揭示表观转录组层面的病理学奥秘。PathoRM将RNA甲基化宿主序列和致病性描述作为输入，并随后采用了大型语言模型、多视图学习算法、图神经网络、对抗性训练方法以及“关联有罪”衍生的负采样方法。PathoRM提炼出语义丰富的特征嵌入，从而在各项指标和数据集上实现了更准确、更稳健的预测性能。值得注意的是，PathoRM通过结合注意力机制，阐明了RNA甲基化位点宿主序列中的“暗物质”，从而赋予自身生物学可解释性。这项工作有望协助致病性RNA甲基化位点和保守基序的发现，从而促进基因组研究的进展。代码和预训练模型可在https://github.com/jianiM/PathoRM获取。

AI & Computational Biology.title: Dynamic dosage changes in X-linked transposable elements during mammalian dosage compensation
AI & Computational Biology.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 11 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41467-025-64865-2X-chromosome dosage compensation involves inactivation and hyperactivation, but the role of transposable elements is unclear. Here, the authors show that X-linked repeats are differentially silenced during inactivation but do not undergo hyperactivation.
AI & Computational Biology.abstract: In mammals, X-linked dosage compensation involves X-chromosome inactivation to balance X chromosome dosage between males and females, and hyperactivation of the remaining X-chromosome (Xa-hyperactivation) to achieve X-autosome balance in both sexes. Studies of both processes have largely focused on coding genes and have not accounted for transposable elements which comprise 50% of the X-chromosome with numerous epigenetic functions. Here we develop a new bioinformatic pipeline tailored to repetitive elements with capability for allelic discrimination. We then apply the pipeline to our recent So-Smart-Seq analysis of single embryos to comprehensively interrogate whether X-linked transposable elements are subject to either X-chromosome inactivation or Xa-hyperactivation. We observe significant differences in repeat silencing in parentally driven “imprinted” versus zygotically driven “random” X-chromosome inactivation. Chromosomal positioning, genetic background and evolutionary age impact their silencing. In contrast, transposable elements do not undergo Xa-hyperactivation. Evolutionary and functional implications are discussed. X-chromosome dosage compensation involves inactivation and hyperactivation, but the role of transposable elements is unclear. Here, the authors show that X-linked repeats are differentially silenced during inactivation but do not undergo hyperactivation.

AI & Computational Biology.title_cn: 哺乳动物剂量补偿过程中X连锁转座元件的动态剂量变化
AI & Computational Biology.abstract_cn: 在哺乳动物中，X连锁剂量补偿涉及X染色体失活以平衡雄性和雌性之间的X染色体剂量，以及剩余X染色体的超活化（Xa超活化）以在两性中实现X-常染色体平衡。对这两种过程的研究主要集中在编码基因上，而未考虑占X染色体50%并具有多种表观遗传功能的转座元件。在此，我们开发了一种针对重复元件的新型生物信息学流程，该流程具有等位基因区分能力。随后，我们将该流程应用于我们近期对单胚胎进行的So-Smart-Seq分析，以全面探究X连锁转座元件是否受到X染色体失活或Xa超活化的影响。我们观察到，在亲本驱动的“印记”与合子驱动的“随机”X染色体失活中，重复序列的沉默存在显著差异。染色体定位、遗传背景和进化年龄影响其沉默。相比之下，转座元件不经历Xa超活化。本文讨论了其进化和功能意义。X染色体剂量补偿涉及失活和超活化，但转座元件的作用尚不明确。本研究表明，X连锁重复序列在失活过程中表现出差异性沉默，但不经历超活化。

AI & Computational Biology.title: A software platform for real-time and adaptive neuroscience experiments
AI & Computational Biology.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 11 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41467-025-64856-3An optimal model-experiment integration for testing many complex hypotheses is still lacking. Here authors introduce improv, a modular software platform enabling real-time adaptive neuroscience experiments, orchestrating parallel data collection, modeling, and experimental control. Authors demonstrate various use cases, including online neural analysis and closed-loop optogenetics in zebrafish.
AI & Computational Biology.abstract: Current neuroscience research is often limited to testing predetermined hypotheses and post hoc analysis of already collected data. Adaptive experimental designs, in which modeling drives ongoing data collection and selects experimental manipulations, offer a promising alternative. However, such adaptive paradigms require tight integration between software and hardware under real-time constraints. We introduce improv, a software platform for flexible integration of modeling, data collection, analysis pipelines, and live experimental control. We demonstrate both in silico and in vivo how improv enables efficient experimental designs for discovery and validation across various model organisms and data types. We used improv to orchestrate real-time behavioral analyses, rapid functional typing of neural responses via calcium imaging, optimal visual stimulus selection, and model-driven optogenetic photostimulation of visually responsive neurons in the zebrafish brain. Together, these results demonstrate the power of improv to integrate modeling with data collection and experimental control to achieve next-generation adaptive experiments. An optimal model-experiment integration for testing many complex hypotheses is still lacking. Here authors introduce improv, a modular software platform enabling real-time adaptive neuroscience experiments, orchestrating parallel data collection, modeling, and experimental control. Authors demonstrate various use cases, including online neural analysis and closed-loop optogenetics in zebrafish.

AI & Computational Biology.title_cn: 一个用于实时和自适应神经科学实验的软件平台
AI & Computational Biology.abstract_cn: 当前的神经科学研究常受限于检验预设假设以及对已收集数据的回顾性分析。自适应实验设计，即通过模型驱动持续数据收集并选择实验操作，提供了一种有前景的替代方案。然而，此类自适应范式要求在实时约束下实现软件与硬件的紧密集成。我们引入了improv，一个能够灵活集成建模、数据收集、分析流程和实时实验控制的软件平台。我们通过计算机模拟（in silico）和体内（in vivo）实验证明了improv如何为各种模式生物和数据类型实现高效的实验设计，以促进科学发现和验证。我们利用improv协调了实时行为分析、通过钙成像对神经反应进行快速功能分型、优化视觉刺激选择，以及在斑马鱼大脑中对视觉响应神经元进行模型驱动的光遗传学光刺激。综上所述，这些结果展示了improv在整合建模与数据收集和实验控制方面的强大能力，从而实现下一代自适应实验。目前，针对许多复杂假设进行测试的最佳模型-实验集成仍有待完善。本文作者在此介绍了improv，一个模块化的软件平台，它能够实现实时自适应神经科学实验，并协调并行的数据收集、建模和实验控制。

Clinical & Medicine.title: Comprehensive echocardiogram evaluation with view primed vision language AI
Clinical & Medicine.summary: Nature, Published online: 11 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09850-xComprehensive echocardiogram evaluation with view primed vision language AI
Clinical & Medicine.abstract: Echocardiography is the most widely used cardiac imaging modality, capturing ultrasound video data to assess cardiac structure and function1. Artificial intelligence (AI) in echocardiography has the potential to streamline manual tasks and improve reproducibility and precision2. However, most echocardiography AI models are single-view, single-task systems that do not synthesize complementary information from multiple views captured during a full exam3,4, and thus lead to limited performance and scope of applications. To address this problem, we introduce EchoPrime, a multi-view, view-informed, video-based vision-language foundation model trained on over 12 million video-report pairs. EchoPrime uses contrastive learning to train a unified embedding model for all standard views in a comprehensive echocardiogram study with representation of both rare and common diseases and diagnoses. EchoPrime then utilizes view-classification and a view-informed anatomic attention module to weight video-specific embeddings that accurately map the relationship between echocardiographic views and anatomical structures. With retrieval-augmented interpretation, EchoPrime integrates information from all echocardiogram videos in a comprehensive study and performs holistic clinical interpretation. In datasets from five international independent healthcare systems, EchoPrime achieves state-of-the art performance on 23 diverse benchmarks of cardiac form and function, surpassing the performance of both task-specific approaches and prior foundation models. Following rigorous clinical evaluation, EchoPrime can assist physicians in the automated preliminary assessment of comprehensive echocardiography.

Clinical & Medicine.title_cn: 基于视图引导视觉语言人工智能的全面超声心动图评估
Clinical & Medicine.abstract_cn: 超声心动图是应用最广泛的心脏影像学检查方法，通过捕获超声视频数据来评估心脏结构和功能1。人工智能（AI）在超声心动图领域的应用有望简化人工操作，提高结果的重现性和精确性2。然而，大多数超声心动图AI模型是单视图、单任务系统，无法综合全面检查中捕获的多个视图的互补信息3,4，从而导致性能和应用范围受限。为解决此问题，我们引入了EchoPrime，这是一个多视图、视图感知、基于视频的视觉语言基础模型，其训练数据超过1200万个视频-报告对。EchoPrime利用对比学习为全面超声心动图研究中的所有标准视图训练一个统一的嵌入模型，该模型能够表示罕见和常见疾病及诊断。随后，EchoPrime利用视图分类和视图感知的解剖注意力模块，对视频特异性嵌入进行加权，从而精确映射超声心动图视图与解剖结构之间的关系。借助检索增强型解释，EchoPrime整合了全面研究中所有超声心动图视频的信息，并进行整体临床解读。在来自五个国际独立医疗系统的数据集中，EchoPrime在23项不同的心脏形态和功能基准测试中取得了最先进的性能，超越了任务特定方法和现有基础模型的表现。经过严格的临床评估，EchoPrime能够辅助医生对全面超声心动图进行自动化初步评估。

Clinical & Medicine.title: Digital dementia and testing of cognitive intervention for degenerating neural networks
Clinical & Medicine.summary: npj Systems Biology and Applications, Published online: 11 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41540-025-00596-wDigital dementia and testing of cognitive intervention for degenerating neural networks
Clinical & Medicine.abstract: The development of effective interventions for neurodegenerative disorders, such as posterior cortical atrophy (a visual Alzheimer’s variant), remains to be a significant clinical challenge. We introduce a computational framework using convolutional neural networks (CNNs) as in silico models to simulate visual system degeneration and evaluate intervention strategies. By modeling controlled synaptic decay and comparing three distinct retraining approaches, random data (control), accuracy-based, and entropy-based, we assess impacts on classification performance and neural representation geometry. Our results demonstrate that accuracy-based retraining outperformed other strategies, maintaining model performance and preserving optimal manifold geometry during intermediate degeneration stages. This computational analysis supports prioritizing accuracy-targeted interventions for cognitive compensation. Our framework enables rapid evaluation of intervention efficacy while elucidating computational principles underlying neurodegeneration and recovery. This approach offers a platform for refining strategies to slow visual-cognitive decline in neurodegenerative diseases, bridging mechanistic insights with clinical translation.

Clinical & Medicine.title_cn: 数字痴呆：退化神经网络认知干预策略的评估
Clinical & Medicine.abstract_cn: 神经退行性疾病（如后皮层萎缩，一种视觉型阿尔茨海默病变体）有效干预措施的开发，仍然是一个重大的临床挑战。本研究引入了一个计算框架，该框架利用卷积神经网络（CNN）作为计算机模拟模型，以模拟视觉系统退化并评估干预策略。通过模拟受控的突触衰减，并比较三种不同的再训练方法——随机数据（对照）、基于准确性和基于熵的方法，我们评估了它们对分类性能和神经表征几何结构的影响。我们的结果表明，在中间退化阶段，基于准确性的再训练优于其他策略，能够保持模型性能并保留最佳流形几何结构。这项计算分析支持优先考虑以准确性为目标的干预措施，以实现认知补偿。我们的框架能够快速评估干预措施的有效性，同时阐明神经退行性变和恢复背后的计算原理。这种方法为完善减缓神经退行性疾病中视觉认知衰退的策略提供了一个平台，将机制洞察与临床转化相结合。

Clinical & Medicine.title: Individual trajectories for recovery of neocortical activity in disorders of consciousness
Clinical & Medicine.summary: by Prejaas K. B. Tewarie, Romesh Abeysuriya, Rajanikant Panda, Pablo Nùñez, Marie M. Vitello, Glenn van der Lande, Olivia Gosseries, Aurore Thibaut, Steven Laureys, Gustavo Deco, Jitka AnnenThe evolution from disturbed brain activity to physiological brain rhythms can precede recovery in patients with disorders of consciousness (DoC). Accordingly, intriguing questions arise: What are the pathophysiological factors associated to disrupted brain rhythms in patients with DoC, and are there potential pathways for individual patients with DoC to return to normal brain rhythms? We addressed these questions at the individual subject level using biophysical simulations based on electroencephalography (EEG). The main findings are that unconscious patients exhibit a loss of excitatory corticothalamic synaptic strength. Synaptic plasticity in this excitatory corticothalamic circuitry facilitates the return of physiological brain rhythms, characterized by the reappearance of spectral peaks and flattening of the aperiodic (1/f) component of the power spectrum, in the selection of patients with DoC, particularly in those who are minimally conscious. The extent to which this occurred was correlated with cerebral glucose uptake. The current findings emphasize the importance of excitatory thalamocortical activity in reestablishing normal brain rhythms after brain injury and show that biophysical modelling of the corticothalamic circuitry could help select patients who might be potentially receptive to treatment and undergo plasticity.

Clinical & Medicine.title_cn: 意识障碍中新皮层活动恢复的个体轨迹
Clinical & Medicine.abstract_cn: 意识障碍 (DoC) 患者中，从紊乱的脑活动演变为生理性脑节律可能预示着恢复。因此，引人深思的问题随之而来：与DoC患者脑节律紊乱相关的病理生理学因素是什么？以及DoC个体患者是否存在恢复正常脑节律的潜在途径？我们利用基于脑电图 (EEG) 的生物物理模拟，在个体受试者层面探讨了这些问题。主要发现是，无意识患者表现出兴奋性皮层-丘脑突触强度的丧失。在该兴奋性皮层-丘脑回路中的突触可塑性，有助于DoC患者（特别是微意识状态患者）生理性脑节律的恢复，其特征表现为频谱峰值的再现以及功率谱中非周期性 (1/f) 成分的平坦化。这种恢复的程度与脑葡萄糖摄取量相关。当前研究结果强调了脑损伤后兴奋性丘脑-皮层活动在重建正常脑节律中的重要性，并表明皮层-丘脑回路的生物物理建模有助于筛选可能对治疗有反应并经历可塑性变化的患者。

Clinical & Medicine.abstract_cn: 识别具有合理解释的致病性RNA甲基化位点对疾病治疗具有重要意义。鉴于体外实验在识别致病性RNA甲基化位点方面的局限性，对能够实现准确推断的计算流程的需求日益增长。受此深远意义的启发，我们开发了PathoRM，一个生物学知情的深度学习模型，用于推断RNA甲基化位点与疾病之间的关联。PathoRM能够提供有说服力的致病性RNA甲基化位点，并揭示表观转录组层面的病理学奥秘。PathoRM将RNA甲基化宿主序列和致病性描述作为输入，并随后采用了大型语言模型、多视图学习算法、图神经网络、对抗性训练方法以及“关联有罪”衍生的负采样方法。PathoRM提炼出语义丰富的特征嵌入，从而在各项指标和数据集上实现了更准确、更稳健的预测性能。值得注意的是，PathoRM通过结合注意力机制，阐明了RNA甲基化位点宿主序列中的“暗物质”，从而赋予自身生物学可解释性。这项工作有望协助致病性RNA甲基化位点和保守基序的发现，从而促进基因组研究的进展。代码和预训练模型可在https://github.com/jianiM/PathoRM获取。

Genetics & Epigenetics.title: Stable clonal contribution of lineage-restricted stem cells to human hematopoiesis
Genetics & Epigenetics.summary: Nature Genetics, Published online: 11 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41588-025-02405-wThis study uses somatic mutations as a natural barcoding system to retrospectively and prospectively trace the fate of hematopoietic stem cells across all major blood cell lineages in healthy aged individuals. It reveals the existence of intrinsically fate-biased hematopoietic stem cells in native human hematopoiesis, validated by transplantation assays.
Genetics & Epigenetics.abstract: Dynamic steady-state lineage contribution of human hematopoietic stem cell (HSC) clones needs to be assessed over time. However, clonal contribution of HSCs has only been investigated at single time points and without assessing the critical erythroid and platelet lineages. Here we screened for somatic mutations in healthy aged individuals, identifying expanded HSC clones accessible for lineage tracing of all major blood cell lineages. In addition to HSC clones with balanced contribution to all lineages, we identified clones with all myeloid lineages but no or few B and T lymphocytes or all myeloid lineages and B cells but no T cells. No other lineage restriction patterns were reproducibly observed. Retrospective phylogenetic inferences uncovered a ‘hierarchical’ pattern of descendant subclones more lineage biased than their ancestral clone and a more common ‘stable’ pattern with descendant subclones showing highly concordant lineage contributions with their ancestral clone, despite decades of separation. Prospective lineage tracing confirmed remarkable stability over years of HSC clones with distinct lineage replenishment patterns. This study uses somatic mutations as a natural barcoding system to retrospectively and prospectively trace the fate of hematopoietic stem cells across all major blood cell lineages in healthy aged individuals. It reveals the existence of intrinsically fate-biased hematopoietic stem cells in native human hematopoiesis, validated by transplantation assays.

Genetics & Epigenetics.title_cn: 谱系受限干细胞对人类造血的稳定克隆贡献
Genetics & Epigenetics.abstract_cn: 人类造血干细胞（HSC）克隆的动态稳态谱系贡献需要随时间进行评估。然而，HSC的克隆贡献此前仅在单一时间点进行过研究，并且未能评估关键的红系和血小板谱系。本研究筛查了健康老年个体中的体细胞突变，从而识别出可用于追踪所有主要血细胞谱系的扩增HSC克隆。除了对所有谱系均有平衡贡献的HSC克隆外，我们还发现了一些克隆，它们对所有髓系谱系均有贡献，但B和T淋巴细胞缺失或极少，或者对所有髓系谱系和B细胞有贡献但T细胞缺失。未观察到其他可重复的谱系限制模式。回顾性系统发育推断揭示了两种模式：一种是“分层”模式，其中子代亚克隆比其祖代克隆表现出更强的谱系偏向性；另一种更常见的“稳定”模式，其中子代亚克隆尽管经过数十年的分离，但与祖代克隆表现出高度一致的谱系贡献。前瞻性谱系追踪证实了具有不同谱系补充模式的HSC克隆在多年内的显著稳定性。本研究利用体细胞突变作为一种天然条形码系统，回顾性地和前瞻性地追踪了健康老年个体中造血干细胞在所有主要血细胞谱系中的命运。它揭示了在天然人类造血过程中存在内在命运偏向的造血干细胞，并通过移植实验得到了验证。

Genetics & Epigenetics.title: Dynamic dosage changes in X-linked transposable elements during mammalian dosage compensation
Genetics & Epigenetics.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 11 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41467-025-64865-2X-chromosome dosage compensation involves inactivation and hyperactivation, but the role of transposable elements is unclear. Here, the authors show that X-linked repeats are differentially silenced during inactivation but do not undergo hyperactivation.
Genetics & Epigenetics.abstract: In mammals, X-linked dosage compensation involves X-chromosome inactivation to balance X chromosome dosage between males and females, and hyperactivation of the remaining X-chromosome (Xa-hyperactivation) to achieve X-autosome balance in both sexes. Studies of both processes have largely focused on coding genes and have not accounted for transposable elements which comprise 50% of the X-chromosome with numerous epigenetic functions. Here we develop a new bioinformatic pipeline tailored to repetitive elements with capability for allelic discrimination. We then apply the pipeline to our recent So-Smart-Seq analysis of single embryos to comprehensively interrogate whether X-linked transposable elements are subject to either X-chromosome inactivation or Xa-hyperactivation. We observe significant differences in repeat silencing in parentally driven “imprinted” versus zygotically driven “random” X-chromosome inactivation. Chromosomal positioning, genetic background and evolutionary age impact their silencing. In contrast, transposable elements do not undergo Xa-hyperactivation. Evolutionary and functional implications are discussed. X-chromosome dosage compensation involves inactivation and hyperactivation, but the role of transposable elements is unclear. Here, the authors show that X-linked repeats are differentially silenced during inactivation but do not undergo hyperactivation.

Genetics & Epigenetics.title_cn: 哺乳动物剂量补偿过程中X连锁转座元件的动态剂量变化
Genetics & Epigenetics.abstract_cn: 在哺乳动物中，X连锁剂量补偿涉及X染色体失活以平衡雄性和雌性之间的X染色体剂量，以及剩余X染色体的超活化（Xa超活化）以在两性中实现X-常染色体平衡。对这两种过程的研究主要集中在编码基因上，而未考虑占X染色体50%并具有多种表观遗传功能的转座元件。在此，我们开发了一种针对重复元件的新型生物信息学流程，该流程具有等位基因区分能力。随后，我们将该流程应用于我们近期对单胚胎进行的So-Smart-Seq分析，以全面探究X连锁转座元件是否受到X染色体失活或Xa超活化的影响。我们观察到，在亲本驱动的“印记”与合子驱动的“随机”X染色体失活中，重复序列的沉默存在显著差异。染色体定位、遗传背景和进化年龄影响其沉默。相比之下，转座元件不经历Xa超活化。本文讨论了其进化和功能意义。X染色体剂量补偿涉及失活和超活化，但转座元件的作用尚不明确。本研究表明，X连锁重复序列在失活过程中表现出差异性沉默，但不经历超活化。

Genetics & Epigenetics.title: Evolutionary characterization of antiviral SAMD9/9L across kingdoms supports ancient convergence and lineage-specific adaptations
Genetics & Epigenetics.summary: Nature Ecology & Evolution, Published online: 11 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41559-025-02845-xA search for analogues of the human SAMD9/9L antiviral genes identifies convergent evolution of this gene family in the bacterial and animal kingdoms, with species-specific and recent genomic signatures indicative of adaptations resulting from evolutionary arms races with viruses.
Genetics & Epigenetics.abstract: Human SAMD9 and SAMD9L are duplicated genes that encode innate immune proteins restricting poxviruses and lentiviruses, such as human immunodeficiency virus (HIV). Mutations in these genes are implicated in genetic diseases and cancer. Here we combined structural similarity searches, phylogenetics and population genomics with experimental assays of SAMD9/9L functions to resolve the evolutionary and functional dynamics of these immune proteins, spanning from prokaryotes to primates. We discovered structural analogues of SAMD9/9L in the antibacteriophage defence system, Avs, resulting from convergent evolution. Further, the predicted nuclease site was conserved in bacterial analogues and was essential for cell death, suggesting a fundamental role in defence across different life kingdoms. Despite this shared immunity, we identified genomic signatures of evolutionary arms races in mammals, with remarkable gene copy number variations. We further unveiled that the absence of SAMD9 in bonobos corresponds to a recent gene loss still segregating in the population. Finally, we found that chimpanzee and bonobo SAMD9Ls have enhanced anti-HIV-1 functions compared with the human orthologue. These SAMD9/9L adaptations probably resulted from strong viral selective pressures, including by lentiviruses, and could contribute to lentiviral resistance in bonobos. Evolutionary characterization of Avs9 and SAMD9/9L provides a deeper understanding of how the immune system adapts to fight viruses over billions of years of evolution. A search for analogues of the human SAMD9/9L antiviral genes identifies convergent evolution of this gene family in the bacterial and animal kingdoms, with species-specific and recent genomic signatures indicative of adaptations resulting from evolutionary arms races with viruses.

Genetics & Epigenetics.title_cn: 抗病毒SAMD9/9L跨界演化特征：揭示古老趋同与谱系特异性适应
Genetics & Epigenetics.abstract_cn: 人类SAMD9和SAMD9L是编码先天免疫蛋白的重复基因，它们能限制痘病毒和慢病毒，如人类免疫缺陷病毒（HIV）。这些基因的突变与遗传疾病和癌症有关。本研究结合结构相似性搜索、系统发育学、群体基因组学以及SAMD9/9L功能的实验分析，旨在解析这些免疫蛋白从原核生物到灵长类动物的演化和功能动态。我们发现，抗噬菌体防御系统Avs中存在SAMD9/9L的结构同源物，这源于趋同演化。此外，预测的核酸酶位点在细菌同源物中是保守的，并且对细胞死亡至关重要，这表明其在不同生命界别的防御中具有基础性作用。尽管存在这种共享免疫机制，我们仍在哺乳动物中识别出演化军备竞赛的基因组特征，伴随着显著的基因拷贝数变异。我们进一步揭示，倭黑猩猩中SAMD9的缺失对应着近期发生的基因丢失，该基因丢失仍在群体中分离。最后，我们发现黑猩猩和倭黑猩猩的SAMD9L与人类直系同源物相比，具有增强的抗HIV-1功能。这些SAMD9/9L的适应性变化可能源于强大的病毒选择压力（包括慢病毒），并可能有助于倭黑猩猩对慢病毒的抵抗力。对Avs9和SAMD9/9L的演化特征分析，为我们深入理解免疫系统如何在数十亿年的演化中适应性地对抗病毒提供了更深层次的认识。这项研究通过对人类SAMD9/9L抗病毒基因同源物的搜索，揭示了该基因家族在细菌界和动物界中的趋同演化，以及由与病毒的演化军备竞赛所导致的物种特异性和近期基因组适应性特征。

Genetics & Epigenetics.title: Reprogramming of H3K36me2 guides lineage-specific post-implantation de novo DNA methylation
Genetics & Epigenetics.summary: Nature Cell Biology, Published online: 11 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41556-025-01805-8Lu, Wang et al. profile H3K36me2 throughout oocyte-to-embryo transition, pre-implantation and early post-implantation development and report a role for H3K36me2 in post-implantation embryos to re-establish lineage-specific DNA methylation.
Genetics & Epigenetics.abstract: In mammals, DNA methylation is re-established after implantation following post-fertilization global erasure. Yet, the underlying mechanism remains elusive. Here we investigate H3K36me2 reprogramming in mouse early development and its role in post-implantation DNA methylation re-establishment. In oocytes, H3K36me2 accumulates in gene bodies upon transcription silencing and partially persists to the eight-cell stage. De novo H3K36me2 occurs at enhancers after zygotic genome activation, before spreading genome-wide after implantation, except on the inactive X chromosome. Mutation of the H3K36me2 methyltransferase NSD1 compromises global DNA methylation after implantation preferentially in extra-embryonic lineages and that at methylation-prone promoters, including those of germline-specific genes. However, DNA methylation establishment partially bypasses H3K36me2 through upregulated DNMT3B, a ‘leaky’ H3K36me2/3 reader. This contrasts with DNMT3A, which strictly requires H3K36me2/3 for DNA methylation through its PWWP domain. Finally, DNA methylation valleys escape de novo DNA methylation via PRC1/H2AK119ub1-mediated H3K36me2 exclusion. Thus, H3K36me2 reprogramming regulates lineage- and locus-specific post-implantation DNA methylation establishment. Lu, Wang et al. profile H3K36me2 throughout oocyte-to-embryo transition, pre-implantation and early post-implantation development and report a role for H3K36me2 in post-implantation embryos to re-establish lineage-specific DNA methylation.

Genetics & Epigenetics.title_cn: H3K36me2重编程引导谱系特异性着床后从头DNA甲基化
Genetics & Epigenetics.abstract_cn: 在哺乳动物中，DNA甲基化在受精后经历全局擦除，并在着床后重新建立。然而，其潜在机制仍不清楚。本研究探讨了小鼠早期发育过程中H3K36me2的重编程及其在着床后DNA甲基化重建中的作用。在卵母细胞中，H3K36me2在转录沉默后积累于基因体，并部分持续到八细胞阶段。受精卵基因组激活后，从头H3K36me2在增强子处发生，随后在着床后全基因组扩散，但失活X染色体除外。H3K36me2甲基转移酶NSD1的突变损害了着床后全局DNA甲基化，尤其是在胚外谱系和易甲基化启动子（包括生殖系特异性基因的启动子）处。然而，DNA甲基化的建立通过上调的DNMT3B（一种“泄漏型”H3K36me2/3读取器）部分绕过了H3K36me2。这与DNMT3A形成对比，后者通过其PWWP结构域严格依赖H3K36me2/3进行DNA甲基化。最后，DNA甲基化谷通过PRC1/H2AK119ub1介导的H3K36me2排斥作用逃避了从头DNA甲基化。因此，H3K36me2重编程调控着谱系和位点特异性的着床后DNA甲基化建立。Lu, Wang等人描绘了H3K36me2在卵母细胞到胚胎转变、着床前和着床后早期发育过程中的图谱，并揭示了H3K36me2在着床后胚胎中重建谱系特异性DNA甲基化中的作用。

Genetics & Epigenetics.title: IPScan: Detecting novel intronic PolyAdenylation events with RNA-seq data
Genetics & Epigenetics.summary: by Naima Ahmed Fahmi, Sze Cheng, Jeovani Overstreet, Qianqian Song, Jeongsik Yong, Wei ZhangIntronic PolyAdenylation (IPA) is an important post-transcriptional mechanism that can alter transcript coding potential by truncating translation regions, thereby increasing transcriptome and proteome diversity. This process generates novel protein isoforms with altered peptide sequences, some of which are implicated in disease progression, including cancer. Truncated proteins may lose tumor-suppressive functions, contributing to oncogenesis. Despite advancements in Alternative PolyAdenylation (APA) analysis using RNA-seq, detecting and quantifying novel IPA events remains challenging. To address this, we developed IPScan, a computational pipeline for precise IPA event identification, quantification, and visualization. IPScan has been benchmarked against existing methods using simulated data, different human and mouse cell lines, and TCGA (The Cancer Genome Atlas) breast cancer datasets. Differential IPA events under different biological conditions were quantified and validated via qPCR.

Genetics & Epigenetics.title_cn: IPScan：基于RNA测序数据检测新型内含子多聚腺苷酸化事件
Genetics & Epigenetics.abstract_cn: 内含子多聚腺苷酸化（IPA）是一种重要的转录后机制，它通过截短翻译区域来改变转录本的编码潜力，从而增加转录组和蛋白质组的多样性。这一过程产生具有改变肽序列的新型蛋白质异构体，其中一些与疾病进展（包括癌症）有关。截短的蛋白质可能丧失肿瘤抑制功能，从而促进肿瘤发生。尽管利用RNA测序进行选择性多聚腺苷酸化（APA）分析取得了进展，但检测和量化新型IPA事件仍然具有挑战性。为解决这一问题，我们开发了IPScan，这是一个用于精确识别、量化和可视化IPA事件的计算流程。IPScan已通过模拟数据、不同人鼠细胞系以及TCGA（癌症基因组图谱）乳腺癌数据集与现有方法进行了基准测试。在不同生物学条件下，差异IPA事件通过qPCR进行了量化和验证。

Genetics & Epigenetics.title: Differential effect of supercoiling on bacterial transcription in topological domains
Genetics & Epigenetics.summary: by Boaz Goldberg, Nicolás Yehya, Jie Xiao, Sam MeyerDNA supercoiling (SC), the over- and under-winding of DNA, is generated by transcription as described in the twin-domain model. Conversely, SC also impacts transcription through torsional stress. SC therefore regulates transcription dynamically and independently of transcription factor binding, particularly in the context of chromosomal topological domains and the activity of topoisomerases in bacteria. In this work, we develop numerical simulations of SC-coupled transcription of a single gene within a topological domain, based on a model incorporating stochastic transcription and activities of topoisomerase I and gyrase. We explore the effect of several parameters not systematically assessed in previous works (role of topoisomerase activities, topological domain size, gene expression strength) and compare the simulation results to a diverse set of experimental observations ranging fromin vitrotranscription assays to transcriptomics datasets from various species. This model recapitulates the non-monotonic dependence of transcriptionin vitrowith the superhelical density of the plasmid template. Simulations ofin vivotranscription in a closed domain exhibit a qualitatively different role for the two topoisomerases, as well as qualitatively different regulatory behaviors depending on the promoter strength. Specifically, topoisomerase I is required for strongly expressed genes that may be hindered by stalled RNA Polymerase, whereas gyrase activity favors the expression of all genes by enhancing transcription initiation and modulating the burstiness of transcription. The simulations exhibit a new mechanism for transcription bursting mediated by negative SC accumulating at the promoter region and modulating the initiation rate, resulting in levels of burstiness compatible with values reported in cells. Finally, we analyze several transcriptomics datasets from a range of evolutionarily distant species and show that topoisomerase inhibition is systematically associated with the repression of highly expressed genes. Simulations show this behavior to occur within a limited parameter range and thus indicate a biologically relevant regime for the simulations. Overall, this work provides a more quantitative description of how SC contributes to differential gene regulation and transcriptional bursting in bacteria.

Genetics & Epigenetics.title_cn: 超螺旋对拓扑结构域中细菌转录的差异性影响
Genetics & Epigenetics.abstract_cn: DNA超螺旋（SC），即DNA的过度和欠螺旋，如双结构域模型所述，由转录产生。反之，SC也通过扭转应力影响转录。因此，SC动态地调控转录，且独立于转录因子结合，尤其是在细菌染色体拓扑结构域和拓扑异构酶活性的背景下。在这项工作中，我们基于一个结合了随机转录以及拓扑异构酶I和旋转酶活性的模型，开发了拓扑结构域内单个基因SC偶联转录的数值模拟。我们探讨了先前工作中未系统评估的几个参数（拓扑异构酶活性的作用、拓扑结构域大小、基因表达强度）的影响，并将模拟结果与从体外转录实验到各种物种转录组数据集的多种实验观察结果进行了比较。该模型再现了体外转录对质粒模板超螺旋密度的非单调依赖性。封闭结构域内体内转录的模拟显示，两种拓扑异构酶具有质的差异性作用，并且根据启动子强度表现出质的差异性调控行为。具体而言，拓扑异构酶I对于可能受阻于停滞RNA聚合酶的强表达基因是必需的，而旋转酶活性通过增强转录起始和调节转录的爆发性来促进所有基因的表达。模拟揭示了一种新的转录爆发机制，该机制由在启动子区域积累的负SC介导并调节起始速率，从而产生与细胞中报道值相符的爆发水平。最后，我们分析了来自一系列进化上远缘物种的多个转录组数据集，并表明拓扑异构酶抑制系统性地与高表达基因的抑制相关。模拟表明这种行为发生在有限的参数范围内，从而指示了模拟的生物学相关区域。总的来说，这项工作更定量地描述了SC如何促进细菌中差异基因调控和转录爆发。

Genetics & Epigenetics.title: PathoRM: Computational inference of pathogenic RNA methylation sites by incorporating multi-view features
Genetics & Epigenetics.summary: by Hui Liu, Jiani Ma, Xianjun Ma, Lin ZhangIdentifying pathogenic RNA methylation sites with a reasonable biological explanation has important implications for the treatment of diseases. Due to the limitations of in vitro experiments in identifying pathogenic RNA methylation sites, there is a growing need for computational workflows to enable accurate inference. Here, motivated by this profound meaning, we developed PathoRM, a biologically informed deep learning model, to infer associations between RNA methylation sites and diseases. PathoRM could provide convincing pathogenic RNA methylation sites and unravel the enigma of pathology in the epi-transcriptomic layer. PathoRM fuses RNA methylation host sequences and pathogenic descriptions as inputs, and subsequently employs large language models, multi-view learning algorithm, graph neural networks, an adversarial training approach, and “guilty-by-association”-derived negative sampling approach. PathoRM distils the semantically enriched feature embeddings, leading to more accurate and robust prediction performance across the metrics and datasets. Notably, incorporated with attention mechanism, PathoRM bestows itself biological interpretability through illuminating the dark matters in the host sequences of RNA methylation sites. This work is expected to assist in the discovery of pathogenic RNA methylation sites and conserved motifs, contributing to the advancement of genome research. Codes and pre-trained model are accessible at https://github.com/jianiM/PathoRM.

Genetics & Epigenetics.title_cn: PathoRM：整合多视图特征的致病性RNA甲基化位点计算推断
Genetics & Epigenetics.abstract_cn: 识别具有合理解释的致病性RNA甲基化位点对疾病治疗具有重要意义。鉴于体外实验在识别致病性RNA甲基化位点方面的局限性，对能够实现准确推断的计算流程的需求日益增长。受此深远意义的启发，我们开发了PathoRM，一个生物学知情的深度学习模型，用于推断RNA甲基化位点与疾病之间的关联。PathoRM能够提供有说服力的致病性RNA甲基化位点，并揭示表观转录组层面的病理学奥秘。PathoRM将RNA甲基化宿主序列和致病性描述作为输入，并随后采用了大型语言模型、多视图学习算法、图神经网络、对抗性训练方法以及“关联有罪”衍生的负采样方法。PathoRM提炼出语义丰富的特征嵌入，从而在各项指标和数据集上实现了更准确、更稳健的预测性能。值得注意的是，PathoRM通过结合注意力机制，阐明了RNA甲基化位点宿主序列中的“暗物质”，从而赋予自身生物学可解释性。这项工作有望协助致病性RNA甲基化位点和保守基序的发现，从而促进基因组研究的进展。代码和预训练模型可在https://github.com/jianiM/PathoRM获取。

Development.title: Multimodal learning enables chat-based exploration of single-cell data
Development.summary: Nature Biotechnology, Published online: 11 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41587-025-02857-9CellWhisperer uses multimodal learning of transcriptomes and text to answer questions about single-cell RNA-sequencing data.
Development.abstract: Single-cell sequencing characterizes biological samples at unprecedented scale and detail, but data interpretation remains challenging. Here, we present CellWhisperer, an artificial intelligence (AI) model and software tool for chat-based interrogation of gene expression. We establish a multimodal embedding of transcriptomes and their textual annotations, using contrastive learning on 1 million RNA sequencing profiles with AI-curated descriptions. This embedding informs a large language model that answers user-provided questions about cells and genes in natural-language chats. We benchmark CellWhisperer’s performance for zero-shot prediction of cell types and other biological annotations and demonstrate its use for biological discovery in a meta-analysis of human embryonic development. We integrate a CellWhisperer chat box with the CELLxGENE browser, allowing users to interactively explore gene expression through a combined graphical and chat interface. In summary, CellWhisperer leverages large community-scale data repositories to connect transcriptomes and text, thereby enabling interactive exploration of single-cell RNA-sequencing data with natural-language chats. CellWhisperer uses multimodal learning of transcriptomes and text to answer questions about single-cell RNA-sequencing data.

Development.title_cn: 多模态学习赋能单细胞数据对话式探索
Development.abstract_cn: 单细胞测序以前所未有的规模和细节表征生物样本，但数据解读仍然具有挑战性。在此，我们介绍CellWhisperer，这是一种用于基因表达对话式查询的人工智能（AI）模型和软件工具。我们利用对比学习，在包含100万个RNA测序图谱及其AI策展描述的数据集上，建立了转录组及其文本注释的多模态嵌入。该嵌入为大型语言模型提供信息，使其能够在自然语言对话中回答用户提出的关于细胞和基因的问题。我们对CellWhisperer在细胞类型和其他生物学注释的零样本预测性能进行了基准测试，并展示了其在人类胚胎发育荟萃分析中用于生物学发现的潜力。我们将CellWhisperer对话框与CELLxGENE浏览器集成，使用户能够通过图形和对话相结合的界面交互式探索基因表达。总之，CellWhisperer利用大型社区规模的数据存储库连接转录组和文本，从而通过自然语言对话实现单细胞RNA测序数据的交互式探索。CellWhisperer利用转录组和文本的多模态学习来回答有关单细胞RNA测序数据的问题。

Development.title: Dynamic dosage changes in X-linked transposable elements during mammalian dosage compensation
Development.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 11 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41467-025-64865-2X-chromosome dosage compensation involves inactivation and hyperactivation, but the role of transposable elements is unclear. Here, the authors show that X-linked repeats are differentially silenced during inactivation but do not undergo hyperactivation.
Development.abstract: In mammals, X-linked dosage compensation involves X-chromosome inactivation to balance X chromosome dosage between males and females, and hyperactivation of the remaining X-chromosome (Xa-hyperactivation) to achieve X-autosome balance in both sexes. Studies of both processes have largely focused on coding genes and have not accounted for transposable elements which comprise 50% of the X-chromosome with numerous epigenetic functions. Here we develop a new bioinformatic pipeline tailored to repetitive elements with capability for allelic discrimination. We then apply the pipeline to our recent So-Smart-Seq analysis of single embryos to comprehensively interrogate whether X-linked transposable elements are subject to either X-chromosome inactivation or Xa-hyperactivation. We observe significant differences in repeat silencing in parentally driven “imprinted” versus zygotically driven “random” X-chromosome inactivation. Chromosomal positioning, genetic background and evolutionary age impact their silencing. In contrast, transposable elements do not undergo Xa-hyperactivation. Evolutionary and functional implications are discussed. X-chromosome dosage compensation involves inactivation and hyperactivation, but the role of transposable elements is unclear. Here, the authors show that X-linked repeats are differentially silenced during inactivation but do not undergo hyperactivation.

Development.title_cn: 哺乳动物剂量补偿过程中X连锁转座元件的动态剂量变化
Development.abstract_cn: 在哺乳动物中，X连锁剂量补偿涉及X染色体失活以平衡雄性和雌性之间的X染色体剂量，以及剩余X染色体的超活化（Xa超活化）以在两性中实现X-常染色体平衡。对这两种过程的研究主要集中在编码基因上，而未考虑占X染色体50%并具有多种表观遗传功能的转座元件。在此，我们开发了一种针对重复元件的新型生物信息学流程，该流程具有等位基因区分能力。随后，我们将该流程应用于我们近期对单胚胎进行的So-Smart-Seq分析，以全面探究X连锁转座元件是否受到X染色体失活或Xa超活化的影响。我们观察到，在亲本驱动的“印记”与合子驱动的“随机”X染色体失活中，重复序列的沉默存在显著差异。染色体定位、遗传背景和进化年龄影响其沉默。相比之下，转座元件不经历Xa超活化。本文讨论了其进化和功能意义。X染色体剂量补偿涉及失活和超活化，但转座元件的作用尚不明确。本研究表明，X连锁重复序列在失活过程中表现出差异性沉默，但不经历超活化。

Development.title: Cellular and molecular mechanisms of seahorse male pregnancy
Development.summary: Nature Ecology & Evolution, Published online: 11 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41559-025-02883-5Seahorses have a unique sex role reversal with male pregnancy involving the brood pouch, an evolutionarily novel organ. This study uses single-cell genomics and in vivo experiments to reveal the cellular basis and molecular mechanism of pouch development and diversity in seahorses.
Development.abstract: Seahorses and their relatives (syngnathids) show a unique sex role reversal. Their male pregnancy is facilitated by an evolutionary novel organ—the brood pouch that functions analogously to the mammalian uterus and placenta despite originating from entirely different tissues. Here we use comparative single-cell multiomics and genomics analyses to investigate the transition from egg laying to pregnancy during syngnathid evolution and compare the convergently evolved life history of placental parental care with that in mammals. In vivo experiments show that a population of epithelial progenitors that possesses pouch-inducing potential and expresses androgen, not female hormones as in other live-bearers, can trigger pouch ontogeny. Two mechanisms ensure functionality of the pouch: recruitment of pseudo-placenta-related cells characterized by expressed orthologous genes also found in mammalian uteri and co-option of specific cells for sticky eggs attached to specialized skin patches of males that express novel seahorse-specific genes such as pastns and syn-lectins. These mechanisms combined drove pouch diversity and complexity in syngnathids. Seahorses have a unique sex role reversal with male pregnancy involving the brood pouch, an evolutionarily novel organ. This study uses single-cell genomics and in vivo experiments to reveal the cellular basis and molecular mechanism of pouch development and diversity in seahorses.

Development.title_cn: 海马雄性妊娠的细胞和分子机制
Development.abstract_cn: 海马及其近亲（海龙科鱼类）展现出独特的性别角色逆转。它们的雄性妊娠由一个进化上新颖的器官——育儿袋——所促成，该育儿袋尽管起源于完全不同的组织，但其功能与哺乳动物的子宫和胎盘类似。在本研究中，我们利用比较单细胞多组学和基因组学分析，探讨了海龙科鱼类进化过程中从产卵到妊娠的转变，并将其与哺乳动物趋同进化的胎盘亲代抚育生命史进行了比较。体内实验表明，一群具有育儿袋诱导潜能并表达雄激素（而非其他胎生动物中的雌激素）的上皮祖细胞能够触发育儿袋的发生。两种机制确保了育儿袋的功能性：一是招募了以在哺乳动物子宫中也发现的表达直系同源基因为特征的假胎盘相关细胞；二是协同利用了雄性特化皮肤斑块上附着粘性卵的特定细胞，这些细胞表达海马特有的新基因，如pastns和syn-lectins。这些机制共同推动了海龙科鱼类育儿袋的多样性和复杂性。海马具有独特的性别角色逆转，雄性妊娠涉及育儿袋这一进化上新颖的器官。本研究利用单细胞基因组学和体内实验揭示了海马育儿袋发育和多样性的细胞基础和分子机制。

Development.title: Reprogramming of H3K36me2 guides lineage-specific post-implantation de novo DNA methylation
Development.summary: Nature Cell Biology, Published online: 11 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41556-025-01805-8Lu, Wang et al. profile H3K36me2 throughout oocyte-to-embryo transition, pre-implantation and early post-implantation development and report a role for H3K36me2 in post-implantation embryos to re-establish lineage-specific DNA methylation.
Development.abstract: In mammals, DNA methylation is re-established after implantation following post-fertilization global erasure. Yet, the underlying mechanism remains elusive. Here we investigate H3K36me2 reprogramming in mouse early development and its role in post-implantation DNA methylation re-establishment. In oocytes, H3K36me2 accumulates in gene bodies upon transcription silencing and partially persists to the eight-cell stage. De novo H3K36me2 occurs at enhancers after zygotic genome activation, before spreading genome-wide after implantation, except on the inactive X chromosome. Mutation of the H3K36me2 methyltransferase NSD1 compromises global DNA methylation after implantation preferentially in extra-embryonic lineages and that at methylation-prone promoters, including those of germline-specific genes. However, DNA methylation establishment partially bypasses H3K36me2 through upregulated DNMT3B, a ‘leaky’ H3K36me2/3 reader. This contrasts with DNMT3A, which strictly requires H3K36me2/3 for DNA methylation through its PWWP domain. Finally, DNA methylation valleys escape de novo DNA methylation via PRC1/H2AK119ub1-mediated H3K36me2 exclusion. Thus, H3K36me2 reprogramming regulates lineage- and locus-specific post-implantation DNA methylation establishment. Lu, Wang et al. profile H3K36me2 throughout oocyte-to-embryo transition, pre-implantation and early post-implantation development and report a role for H3K36me2 in post-implantation embryos to re-establish lineage-specific DNA methylation.
Development.authors_short: Lu, Xukun et al., Xie, Wei
Development.title_cn: H3K36me2重编程引导谱系特异性着床后从头DNA甲基化
Development.abstract_cn: 在哺乳动物中，DNA甲基化在受精后经历全局擦除，并在着床后重新建立。然而，其潜在机制仍不清楚。本研究探讨了小鼠早期发育过程中H3K36me2的重编程及其在着床后DNA甲基化重建中的作用。在卵母细胞中，H3K36me2在转录沉默后积累于基因体，并部分持续到八细胞阶段。受精卵基因组激活后，从头H3K36me2在增强子处发生，随后在着床后全基因组扩散，但失活X染色体除外。H3K36me2甲基转移酶NSD1的突变损害了着床后全局DNA甲基化，尤其是在胚外谱系和易甲基化启动子（包括生殖系特异性基因的启动子）处。然而，DNA甲基化的建立通过上调的DNMT3B（一种“泄漏型”H3K36me2/3读取器）部分绕过了H3K36me2。这与DNMT3A形成对比，后者通过其PWWP结构域严格依赖H3K36me2/3进行DNA甲基化。最后，DNA甲基化谷通过PRC1/H2AK119ub1介导的H3K36me2排斥作用逃避了从头DNA甲基化。因此，H3K36me2重编程调控着谱系和位点特异性的着床后DNA甲基化建立。Lu, Wang等人描绘了H3K36me2在卵母细胞到胚胎转变、着床前和着床后早期发育过程中的图谱，并揭示了H3K36me2在着床后胚胎中重建谱系特异性DNA甲基化中的作用。

Cancer.title: Wild-type KRAS activation drives evasion of interferon-mediated immunity and resistance to immunotherapy in hepatocellular carcinoma
Cancer.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 11 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41467-025-64860-7Increasing evidence suggests that activation of oncogenic pathways contributes to an unfavorable tumor microenvironment. Here, the authors show that wild-type KRAS plays a key role in immune evasion in hepatocellular carcinoma by impairing interferon-mediated immunity and promoting resistance to immunotherapy via the EGFR/MEK/ERK pathway.
Cancer.abstract: Increasing evidence indicates that activation of oncogenic pathways contributes to an unfavourable tumour immune microenvironment (TIME), ultimately resulting in resistance to immunotherapy. Here, we aim to identify a critical oncogenic pathway involved in an antigen-expressing c-MYC-lucOSOE/Tp53KO hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) mouse model that simulates immune response against tumour-associated antigens. Using data-independent acquisition proteomics, we reveal the role of wild-type KRAS in immune escaped mouse HCC tumours, with EGF concurrently activating EGFR/MEK/ERK signalling. Single cell RNA sequencing data analysis reveals that KRAS signalling intrinsically inhibits interferon-mediated MHC-I expression and extrinsically impairs CD8+ T cell activity due to the suppression of CXCL9 through the EGFR/MEK/ERK pathway. We observe KRAS activation in HCC patients who received immune checkpoint inhibitor (ICI) treatments, where it correlates with poor clinical outcomes. Notably, combination therapy with SOS1 inhibitor MRTX0902, Trametinib, and anti-PD-1 antibody effectively increased intratumoural CD8+ T cell infiltration and improved survival. Our study thus reveals that targeting wild-type KRAS signalling in combination with ICIs may serve as an effective treatment strategy for advanced HCC patients. Increasing evidence suggests that activation of oncogenic pathways contributes to an unfavorable tumor microenvironment. Here, the authors show that wild-type KRAS plays a key role in immune evasion in hepatocellular carcinoma by impairing interferon-mediated immunity and promoting resistance to immunotherapy via the EGFR/MEK/ERK pathway.
Cancer.authors_short: Lei, Martina Mang Leng et al., Lee, Terence Kin Wah
Cancer.title_cn: 野生型KRAS激活驱动肝细胞癌中干扰素介导的免疫逃逸和免疫治疗抵抗
Cancer.abstract_cn: 越来越多的证据表明，致癌通路激活会导致不利的肿瘤免疫微环境（TIME），最终导致对免疫治疗的抵抗。本研究旨在识别在表达抗原的c-MYC-lucOSOE/Tp53KO肝细胞癌（HCC）小鼠模型中涉及的关键致癌通路，该模型模拟了针对肿瘤相关抗原的免疫反应。利用数据非依赖性采集蛋白质组学，我们揭示了野生型KRAS在免疫逃逸的小鼠HCC肿瘤中的作用，同时表皮生长因子（EGF）激活了EGFR/MEK/ERK信号通路。单细胞RNA测序数据分析表明，KRAS信号通路通过EGFR/MEK/ERK通路抑制CXCL9，从而内在性地抑制干扰素介导的MHC-I表达，并外在性地损害CD8+ T细胞活性。我们观察到接受免疫检查点抑制剂（ICI）治疗的HCC患者中存在KRAS激活，这与较差的临床预后相关。值得注意的是，SOS1抑制剂MRTX0902、曲美替尼（Trametinib）和抗PD-1抗体的联合治疗有效增加了肿瘤内CD8+ T细胞浸润并改善了生存期。因此，我们的研究揭示，靶向野生型KRAS信号通路并结合ICI可能成为晚期HCC患者的有效治疗策略，突显了野生型KRAS通过损害干扰素介导的免疫并经由EGFR/MEK/ERK通路促进免疫治疗抵抗，在免疫逃逸中发挥的关键作用。

Cancer.title: IPScan: Detecting novel intronic PolyAdenylation events with RNA-seq data
Cancer.summary: by Naima Ahmed Fahmi, Sze Cheng, Jeovani Overstreet, Qianqian Song, Jeongsik Yong, Wei ZhangIntronic PolyAdenylation (IPA) is an important post-transcriptional mechanism that can alter transcript coding potential by truncating translation regions, thereby increasing transcriptome and proteome diversity. This process generates novel protein isoforms with altered peptide sequences, some of which are implicated in disease progression, including cancer. Truncated proteins may lose tumor-suppressive functions, contributing to oncogenesis. Despite advancements in Alternative PolyAdenylation (APA) analysis using RNA-seq, detecting and quantifying novel IPA events remains challenging. To address this, we developed IPScan, a computational pipeline for precise IPA event identification, quantification, and visualization. IPScan has been benchmarked against existing methods using simulated data, different human and mouse cell lines, and TCGA (The Cancer Genome Atlas) breast cancer datasets. Differential IPA events under different biological conditions were quantified and validated via qPCR.

Cancer.title_cn: IPScan：基于RNA测序数据检测新型内含子多聚腺苷酸化事件
Cancer.abstract_cn: 内含子多聚腺苷酸化（IPA）是一种重要的转录后机制，它通过截短翻译区域来改变转录本的编码潜力，从而增加转录组和蛋白质组的多样性。这一过程产生具有改变肽序列的新型蛋白质异构体，其中一些与疾病进展（包括癌症）有关。截短的蛋白质可能丧失肿瘤抑制功能，从而促进肿瘤发生。尽管利用RNA测序进行选择性多聚腺苷酸化（APA）分析取得了进展，但检测和量化新型IPA事件仍然具有挑战性。为解决这一问题，我们开发了IPScan，这是一个用于精确识别、量化和可视化IPA事件的计算流程。IPScan已通过模拟数据、不同人鼠细胞系以及TCGA（癌症基因组图谱）乳腺癌数据集与现有方法进行了基准测试。在不同生物学条件下，差异IPA事件通过qPCR进行了量化和验证。

Cancer.title: A linear pathway for inositol pyrophosphate metabolism revealed by <sup>18</sup>O labeling and model reduction
Cancer.summary: by Jacques Hermes, Geun-Don Kim, Guizhen Liu, Maria Giovanna De Leo, Andreas Mayer, Henning Jessen, Jens TimmerThe homeostasis of intracellular inorganic phosphate is essential for eukaryotic metabolism and is regulated by the INPHORS signalling pathway, which employs inositol pyrophosphates (IPPs) as key intermediary messengers. This study investigates the metabolic pathways of inositol pyrophosphates (IPPs) in the yeast cell line ΔSPX and the human tumor cell line HCT116. Utilizing pulse-labelling experiments with18O water and ordinary differential equation (ODE) models, we explore the synthesis and turnover of the highly phosphorylated IPP, 1,5-InsP8. Our findings challenge the notion that 1,5-InsP8can be synthesized through distinct routes, revealing a linear reaction sequence in both systems. Employing model reduction via the profile likelihood method, we achieved statistically concise identifiability analysis that led to significant biological insights. In yeast, we determined that 1,5-InsP8production primarily occurs through the phosphorylation of 5-InsP7, with the pathway involving 1-InsP7deemed unnecessary as its removal did not compromise model accuracy. Crucially, this prediction of altered IPP concentrations was validated experimentally invip1Δ andkcs1Δ knockout strains, providing orthogonal biological support for the reduced model. In HCT116 cells, 1,5-InsP8synthesis is mainly driven by 1-InsP7, with variations observed across different experimental conditions. These results underscore the utility of model reduction in enhancing our understanding of metabolic pathways, coupling predictive modeling with experimental validation, and providing a framework for future investigations into the regulation and implications of linear IPP pathways in eukaryotic cells.

Cancer.title_cn: 18O标记和模型降维揭示肌醇焦磷酸代谢的线性通路
Cancer.abstract_cn: 细胞内无机磷酸盐的稳态对真核生物代谢至关重要，并受INPHORS信号通路的调控，该通路利用肌醇焦磷酸（IPPs）作为关键中间信使。本研究调查了酵母细胞系ΔSPX和人肿瘤细胞系HCT116中肌醇焦磷酸（IPPs）的代谢途径。我们利用18O水脉冲标记实验和常微分方程（ODE）模型，探究了高度磷酸化的IPPs——1,5-InsP8的合成与周转。我们的发现挑战了1,5-InsP8可通过不同途径合成的观点，揭示了在两种系统中均存在线性反应序列。通过剖面似然法进行模型降维，我们实现了统计学上简洁的可识别性分析，从而获得了重要的生物学见解。在酵母中，我们确定1,5-InsP8的产生主要通过5-InsP7的磷酸化进行，而涉及1-InsP7的途径被认为是多余的，因为其去除并未损害模型准确性。至关重要的是，这种对IPPs浓度变化的预测在vip1Δ和kcs1Δ敲除菌株中得到了实验验证，为简化模型提供了正交的生物学支持。在HCT116细胞中，1,5-InsP8的合成主要由1-InsP7驱动，并且在不同实验条件下观察到差异。这些结果强调了模型降维在增强我们对代谢途径理解方面的效用，将预测性建模与实验验证相结合，并为未来研究真核细胞中线性IPPs途径的调控和意义提供了框架。

Immunology.title: Wild-type KRAS activation drives evasion of interferon-mediated immunity and resistance to immunotherapy in hepatocellular carcinoma
Immunology.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 11 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41467-025-64860-7Increasing evidence suggests that activation of oncogenic pathways contributes to an unfavorable tumor microenvironment. Here, the authors show that wild-type KRAS plays a key role in immune evasion in hepatocellular carcinoma by impairing interferon-mediated immunity and promoting resistance to immunotherapy via the EGFR/MEK/ERK pathway.
Immunology.abstract: Increasing evidence indicates that activation of oncogenic pathways contributes to an unfavourable tumour immune microenvironment (TIME), ultimately resulting in resistance to immunotherapy. Here, we aim to identify a critical oncogenic pathway involved in an antigen-expressing c-MYC-lucOSOE/Tp53KO hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) mouse model that simulates immune response against tumour-associated antigens. Using data-independent acquisition proteomics, we reveal the role of wild-type KRAS in immune escaped mouse HCC tumours, with EGF concurrently activating EGFR/MEK/ERK signalling. Single cell RNA sequencing data analysis reveals that KRAS signalling intrinsically inhibits interferon-mediated MHC-I expression and extrinsically impairs CD8+ T cell activity due to the suppression of CXCL9 through the EGFR/MEK/ERK pathway. We observe KRAS activation in HCC patients who received immune checkpoint inhibitor (ICI) treatments, where it correlates with poor clinical outcomes. Notably, combination therapy with SOS1 inhibitor MRTX0902, Trametinib, and anti-PD-1 antibody effectively increased intratumoural CD8+ T cell infiltration and improved survival. Our study thus reveals that targeting wild-type KRAS signalling in combination with ICIs may serve as an effective treatment strategy for advanced HCC patients. Increasing evidence suggests that activation of oncogenic pathways contributes to an unfavorable tumor microenvironment. Here, the authors show that wild-type KRAS plays a key role in immune evasion in hepatocellular carcinoma by impairing interferon-mediated immunity and promoting resistance to immunotherapy via the EGFR/MEK/ERK pathway.

Immunology.title_cn: 野生型KRAS激活驱动肝细胞癌中干扰素介导的免疫逃逸和免疫治疗抵抗
Immunology.abstract_cn: 越来越多的证据表明，致癌通路激活会导致不利的肿瘤免疫微环境（TIME），最终导致对免疫治疗的抵抗。本研究旨在识别在表达抗原的c-MYC-lucOSOE/Tp53KO肝细胞癌（HCC）小鼠模型中涉及的关键致癌通路，该模型模拟了针对肿瘤相关抗原的免疫反应。利用数据非依赖性采集蛋白质组学，我们揭示了野生型KRAS在免疫逃逸的小鼠HCC肿瘤中的作用，同时表皮生长因子（EGF）激活了EGFR/MEK/ERK信号通路。单细胞RNA测序数据分析表明，KRAS信号通路通过EGFR/MEK/ERK通路抑制CXCL9，从而内在性地抑制干扰素介导的MHC-I表达，并外在性地损害CD8+ T细胞活性。我们观察到接受免疫检查点抑制剂（ICI）治疗的HCC患者中存在KRAS激活，这与较差的临床预后相关。值得注意的是，SOS1抑制剂MRTX0902、曲美替尼（Trametinib）和抗PD-1抗体的联合治疗有效增加了肿瘤内CD8+ T细胞浸润并改善了生存期。因此，我们的研究揭示，靶向野生型KRAS信号通路并结合ICI可能成为晚期HCC患者的有效治疗策略，突显了野生型KRAS通过损害干扰素介导的免疫并经由EGFR/MEK/ERK通路促进免疫治疗抵抗，在免疫逃逸中发挥的关键作用。

Immunology.title: Evolutionary characterization of antiviral SAMD9/9L across kingdoms supports ancient convergence and lineage-specific adaptations
Immunology.summary: Nature Ecology & Evolution, Published online: 11 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41559-025-02845-xA search for analogues of the human SAMD9/9L antiviral genes identifies convergent evolution of this gene family in the bacterial and animal kingdoms, with species-specific and recent genomic signatures indicative of adaptations resulting from evolutionary arms races with viruses.
Immunology.abstract: Human SAMD9 and SAMD9L are duplicated genes that encode innate immune proteins restricting poxviruses and lentiviruses, such as human immunodeficiency virus (HIV). Mutations in these genes are implicated in genetic diseases and cancer. Here we combined structural similarity searches, phylogenetics and population genomics with experimental assays of SAMD9/9L functions to resolve the evolutionary and functional dynamics of these immune proteins, spanning from prokaryotes to primates. We discovered structural analogues of SAMD9/9L in the antibacteriophage defence system, Avs, resulting from convergent evolution. Further, the predicted nuclease site was conserved in bacterial analogues and was essential for cell death, suggesting a fundamental role in defence across different life kingdoms. Despite this shared immunity, we identified genomic signatures of evolutionary arms races in mammals, with remarkable gene copy number variations. We further unveiled that the absence of SAMD9 in bonobos corresponds to a recent gene loss still segregating in the population. Finally, we found that chimpanzee and bonobo SAMD9Ls have enhanced anti-HIV-1 functions compared with the human orthologue. These SAMD9/9L adaptations probably resulted from strong viral selective pressures, including by lentiviruses, and could contribute to lentiviral resistance in bonobos. Evolutionary characterization of Avs9 and SAMD9/9L provides a deeper understanding of how the immune system adapts to fight viruses over billions of years of evolution. A search for analogues of the human SAMD9/9L antiviral genes identifies convergent evolution of this gene family in the bacterial and animal kingdoms, with species-specific and recent genomic signatures indicative of adaptations resulting from evolutionary arms races with viruses.

Immunology.title_cn: 抗病毒SAMD9/9L跨界演化特征：揭示古老趋同与谱系特异性适应
Immunology.abstract_cn: 人类SAMD9和SAMD9L是编码先天免疫蛋白的重复基因，它们能限制痘病毒和慢病毒，如人类免疫缺陷病毒（HIV）。这些基因的突变与遗传疾病和癌症有关。本研究结合结构相似性搜索、系统发育学、群体基因组学以及SAMD9/9L功能的实验分析，旨在解析这些免疫蛋白从原核生物到灵长类动物的演化和功能动态。我们发现，抗噬菌体防御系统Avs中存在SAMD9/9L的结构同源物，这源于趋同演化。此外，预测的核酸酶位点在细菌同源物中是保守的，并且对细胞死亡至关重要，这表明其在不同生命界别的防御中具有基础性作用。尽管存在这种共享免疫机制，我们仍在哺乳动物中识别出演化军备竞赛的基因组特征，伴随着显著的基因拷贝数变异。我们进一步揭示，倭黑猩猩中SAMD9的缺失对应着近期发生的基因丢失，该基因丢失仍在群体中分离。最后，我们发现黑猩猩和倭黑猩猩的SAMD9L与人类直系同源物相比，具有增强的抗HIV-1功能。这些SAMD9/9L的适应性变化可能源于强大的病毒选择压力（包括慢病毒），并可能有助于倭黑猩猩对慢病毒的抵抗力。对Avs9和SAMD9/9L的演化特征分析，为我们深入理解免疫系统如何在数十亿年的演化中适应性地对抗病毒提供了更深层次的认识。这项研究通过对人类SAMD9/9L抗病毒基因同源物的搜索，揭示了该基因家族在细菌界和动物界中的趋同演化，以及由与病毒的演化军备竞赛所导致的物种特异性和近期基因组适应性特征。

Immunology.title: Single-cell analysis reveals cell death as driver of NLRP3-mediated secretion of IL-1β in human monocytes
Immunology.summary: Nature Immunology, Published online: 11 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41590-025-02319-zLamkanfi, Shirasaki, Izawa and colleagues show that IL-1β release in human monocytes stimulated with lipopolysaccharide or carrying NLRP3 activatory mutations is mostly restricted to cells undergoing lytic cell death.
Immunology.abstract: Interleukin-1β (IL-1β) is a key proinflammatory cytokine with critical roles in infections and inflammatory diseases, yet the mechanisms regulating its release from human monocytes remain unclear. Here we used a suite of single-cell approaches, including integrated live-cell imaging of secretion and cell fate, flow cytometry and high-content imaging, to investigate IL-1β secretion dynamics in lipopolysaccharide-stimulated primary human peripheral blood CD14+ monocytes. We found marked heterogeneity: a large fraction of cells remained viable and contributed negligibly to IL-1β secretion, challenging established models. Instead, a small subset (5–10%) undergoing canonical NLRP3 inflammasome activation and GSDMD-dependent pyroptosis produced the majority of secreted IL-1β, with a smaller contribution from apoptotic cells transitioning to secondary necrosis. Single-cell profiling of CD14+ monocytes from patients with cryopyrin-associated periodic syndrome confirmed lytic cell death as the driver of pathological IL-1β release. These findings redefine IL-1β as a damage-associated molecular pattern, secreted predominantly by dying monocytes. Lamkanfi, Shirasaki, Izawa and colleagues show that IL-1β release in human monocytes stimulated with lipopolysaccharide or carrying NLRP3 activatory mutations is mostly restricted to cells undergoing lytic cell death.

Immunology.title_cn: 单细胞分析揭示细胞死亡是人单核细胞中NLRP3介导的IL-1β分泌的驱动因素
Immunology.abstract_cn: 白细胞介素-1β (IL-1β) 是一种关键的促炎细胞因子，在感染和炎症性疾病中发挥重要作用，然而，其从人单核细胞中释放的调控机制仍不清楚。在本研究中，我们采用了一系列单细胞方法，包括分泌和细胞命运的整合活细胞成像、流式细胞术和高内涵成像，以研究脂多糖刺激的原代人外周血CD14+单核细胞中IL-1β的分泌动态。我们发现显著的异质性：大部分细胞保持存活，对IL-1β分泌的贡献微乎其微，这挑战了既有的模型。相反，一小部分（5-10%）经历经典NLRP3炎性体激活和GSDMD依赖性焦亡的细胞产生了大部分分泌的IL-1β，而凋亡细胞向继发性坏死转变的贡献较小。对冷吡啉相关周期性综合征患者CD14+单核细胞的单细胞分析证实，裂解性细胞死亡是病理性IL-1β释放的驱动因素。这些发现将IL-1β重新定义为一种损伤相关分子模式，主要由垂死的单核细胞分泌。Lamkanfi、Shirasaki、Izawa及其同事的研究表明，在脂多糖刺激或携带NLRP3激活突变的人单核细胞中，IL-1β的释放主要局限于经历裂解性细胞死亡的细胞。

Immunology.title: A phage-encoded anti-CRISPR protein co-opts host enolase to prevent type III CRISPR immunity
Immunology.summary: Nature Microbiology, Published online: 11 November 2025;doi:10.1038/s41564-025-02178-2Streptococcus thermophilus phages circumvent host CRISPR defences via AcrIIIA2, which complexes with enolase, a highly abundant glycolysis enzyme, to block phage RNA binding.
Immunology.abstract: CRISPR (Clustered Regularly Interspaced Short Palindromic Repeats) systems provide powerful adaptive immunity against phage infection. In response, phages use anti-CRISPR (Acr) proteins to evade CRISPR immunity. The few type III Acrs identified so far show conditional effectiveness in countering type III immunity or rely on unknown or poorly understood inhibitory mechanisms. Here we report the discovery of AcrIIIA2, a type III-A Acr encoded by Streptococcus thermophilus phages. Biochemical and structural analyses reveal that phage AcrIIIA2 co-opts host enolase, a highly abundant glycolysis enzyme, to form a ternary complex with the S. thermophilus type III-A (Csm) CRISPR ribonucleoprotein complex, obstructing its immune responses. The enolase-chaperoned AcrIIIA2 blocks the initial step of phage RNA binding, thereby preventing downstream type III anti-phage immune responses. Enolase participates in the anti-immune response by serving as an essential structural scaffold, stabilizing Acr–CRISPR interactions. These findings uncover a new anti-defence strategy that exploits a well-conserved host factor to block CRISPR immunity. Streptococcus thermophilus phages circumvent host CRISPR defences via AcrIIIA2, which complexes with enolase, a highly abundant glycolysis enzyme, to block phage RNA binding.
